tr.td:
Possible recent sinus infection and dryness from heat causing recurrent epistaxis
Exacerbating factor: O2 dependency and ASA
No obvious site for cauterization over septum
2023-06-02 Nasal endoscopy done for recurrent epistaxis
Rt sided septum cauterized
She will start Clindamycin and Mupirocin

text.paragraph: Patient educational handouts: No information available.

tr.td: Avoid nose blowing. Squirt 2 sprays of Afrin and Apply gentle pressure and ice pack on the nasal dorsum and bend forwards when bleeding starts.

act.text: avoid nose blowing. squirt 2 sprays of afrin and apply gentle pressure and ice pack on the nasal dorsum and bend forwards when bleeding starts.

td.content:
Afrin (oxymetazoline) 0.05 % nasal spray
Spray 2 sprays twice a day by intranasal route as needed for 3 days.
albuterol sulfate HFA 90 mcg/actuation aerosol inhaler

cephalexin 500 mg capsule
Take 1 capsule 3 times a day by oral route with meals for 7 days.

clindamycin HCl 300 mg capsule
Take 1 capsule 3 times a day by oral route with meals for 7 days.

gabapentin 300 mg capsule
Take 2 capsules 3 times a day by oral route.
ipratropium 0.5 mg-albuterol 3 mg (2.5 mg base)/3 mL nebulization soln
Lantus Solostar U-100 Insulin 100 unit/mL (3 mL) subcutaneous pen

Lyrica 300 mg capsule
Take 1 capsule twice a day by oral route.

mupirocin 2 % topical ointment
APPLY A SMALL AMOUNT TO THE AFFECTED AREA BY TOPICAL ROUTE 2 TIMES PER DAY
Ozempic 0.25 mg or 0.5 mg (2 mg/1.5 mL) subcutaneous pen injector
potassium chloride ER 10 mEq capsule,extended release
potassium chloride ER 10 mEq tablet,extended release
Spiriva with HandiHaler 18 mcg and inhalation capsules
Symbicort 160 mcg-4.5 mcg/actuation HFA aerosol inhaler
venlafaxine ER 150 mg capsule,extended release 24 hr

td.content: Nicolas, MD: 4876 Powell Inlet Suite 305, 00377 Clements Mountain, Memphis, TN 37907, Ph. (+1-3720093597

tr.td: Onset/Timing: new onset, recurring, initially started 2, months2, months ago. Location: no nasal discharge, bleeds from nostril left, bleeding down the throat, nasal passage blockage bilaterally. Quality: worsening, congested. Duration: bleeding stops spontaneously. Severity: no pain, no previous emergency room visits, limits daily activities. Context: no history of nasal trauma, no nose picking, not worse with seasonal allergen exposure, not worse with environmental exposure, not worse with odors, currently taking aspirin, recent upper respiratory infection. Risk Factors: no history of nasal trauma with bleeding, no current smoking or tobacco use, easy bleeding tendency, oxygen supplement by nasal canula. Alleviating factors: stops with manual pressure. Aggravating factors: nothing makes it worse. Associated Symptoms: nasal discharge, nasal dryness, difficulty breathing; mouth breather

td.content: NP presents w daughter for worsening recurrent left sided nose bleeds which run down in her throat
Had a major episode 3 weeks ago and she was about to go to ER but bleeding stopped
chronic mouth breather as has chronic nasal congestion possible allergies
2023-06-02 f/u patient who was lost for a f/u returns again for recurrent Rt sided nose bleed.
Reports she bled 3 times last weekend
Last bleeding episode was on Monday

tr.td: Constitutional: no fatigue, no fever, no significant weight loss, no significant weight gain

Ears: no hearing loss, no difficulty hearing, no ear pain, no vertigo, no tinnitus, no ear pressure, no drainage/discharge. Nose: no nasal congestion, no rhinorrhea, no sinus pressure, no blockage/obstsruction, frequent nosebleeds. Mouth/Throat: no sore throat, no mouth ulcers, no difficulty swallowing, no post nasal drip, no hoarseness
Neuro: no fainting, no frequent headaches, no weakness
Cardio: no chest pain, no h/o murmur, no dyspnea on exertion, no edema
Lungs: no wheezing, no shortness of breath, no sputum production
Genitourinary: no difficulty urinating. Gastrointestinal: no vomiting, no painful swallowing, no heartburn, normal appetite
Lymph: no swollen glands, no abnormal bruising, no bleeding problems
Skin: no rash, no itching, no dry skin
Allergy/Immunologic: no sneezing, no runny nose
General Appearance: well groomed, in no acute distress, ill-appearing, obese; walker dependent. Communication: normal communication w/o aids, normal voice quality
Inspection: atraumatic. Facial strength: normal symmetry. Sinuses: no tenderness

Nasal Dorsum: symmetric with no visible or palpable deformities. Nasal Mucosa: pale, swollen, edematous, hypertrophy, boggy, clear discharge. Septum: deviated to the right, right telangiectasia. Turbinates: right inferior turbinate hypertrophy , left inferior turbinate hypertrophy , swollen
